snippet.title: Netflix Buys Millarworld, Mark Millar's Creator-Owned Publishing House
snippet.content:
The stable of characters thought up by the writer who co-created Wanted, Kingsmen and Kick-Ass has been bought by one of the biggest players in filmed entertainment.
Image: Jupiter's Legacy, art by Frank Quitely
Announced last night via press release, Netflix's purchase of Millarworld makes the streaming service the exclusive home of the British creator's yet-to-be-optioned properties. Here's the relevant stuff from the Netflix release:
Millar put forth words of his own on the , including a special acknowledgement to the artists he's worked with and noting that Kick-Ass and Kingsmen have special deals elsewhere:
It will be interesting to see which Millar-brand (TM) properties wind up being adapted at Netflix first. I'd put money on something character-driven like MPH being on the fast track. Oh, man, that happened totally by accident...
